intro: Psacalium pippenianum, commonly known as the Pippen's psacalium, is a rare flowering plant native to the humid lowland forests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy pink to purple flowers that bloom during the rainy season. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, black seeds. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation and conservation.
